We're working on a bunch of stuff to make this easier

Llama2 is significantly worse on coding tasks - is that why it's not nearly as good at agentic tasks as GPT models?

Up on YouTube now: https://t.co/EB8IdmcK9z

Reminder about this happening tonight!

Will be a great opportunity to hear a bunch of interesting talks more focused on a particular area

This one's on bio. What specific areas should we deep dive into next?

https://t.co/BKkpTpFPHq https://t.co/4JiwYqCVIM

name: Vivek Natarajan
bio: Advancing Biomedical AI @GoogleAI | Previously @facebookai Research | Definite Optimist
texts:
Medicine is inherently multimodal.

Thrilled to share Med-PaLM M, the first demonstration of a generalist multimodal biomedical AI system with a stellar team @GoogleAI @GoogleDeepMind @GoogleHealth 

Paper: https://t.co/oEMXZSW2bK https://t.co/ZgEtG0gXEs

I got my EB1-A green card last year - it’s life altering. 

Indebted to the incredible generosity of folks I met through this platform who wrote recommendations for me. 

Hope to pay it forward - if you are going through the process and need letters, please reach out if helpful.

The system is good but hopefully tweaks are made to prevent gamification and prioritize the deserving. 

Need to ensure exceptional people like @RSabareesh working on semiconductors  - can’t publish, but whose expertise is perhaps of the highest importance to the US today - also…

Delighted to share that our Large Language Model (LLM) for medicine, Med-PaLM, has been published in @Nature today.

https://t.co/Ip49EOOR1u

With a dream team of co-authors @alan_karthi @AziziShekoofeh @taotu831 @thekaransinghal and many more at @GoogleAI @GoogleHealth

also a heartfelt thank you to @Mysiak who has been inspiring presence in all of our Med-PaLM research! 

People like Juro are what makes @GoogleAI such a special place to work!
When people ask about Med-PaLM 2 vs GPT-4, emails such as these are what we point to :) https://t.co/2G99ZW0oe6

Thread contextualizing Med-PaLM 2 v GPT-4 results reported in our paper.

Benchmarks such as MedQA (USMLE) are nice but misleading indicators of LLM performance and rigorous evaluation is necessary.

Our work is fully focussed on that and we encourage the community to do the same

Pleased to share our latest @GoogleAI @GoogleHealth pre-print on Med-PaLM 2 where we detail our progress towards physician expert-level medical question answering performance!

Link: https://t.co/RS6FSUISd0 https://t.co/tSx5TRbn4K

With a stellar team @GoogleAI @GoogleHealth @DeepMind including @thekaransinghal, @AziziShekoofeh, @taotu831, @alan_karthi, @Mysiak, Rory Sayres, Ellery Wulczyn, @stephenpfohl, @weballergy, @greg_corrado, @ymatias and many others.
some qualitative examples here below comparing Med-PaLM 2 and Med-PaLM responses. https://t.co/0JVueoSvx0

GCP: We don't need support, our product is too good

name: shreya rajpal
bio: ML, systems, and everything in between. Building @guardrails_ai. Previously founding eng @predibase, @Apple SPG, @driveai_, @IllinoisCS, @iitdelhi.
texts:
I had a fantastic time talking about Guardrails for LLMs at the LLMs in Production Conference II. You can check out the whole presentation here ⬇️

https://t.co/LkznWPKxSX

Excited to be giving a talk at the @databricks’ Data + AI summit this afternoon

Swing by Hall F to learn more about how your enterprise AI needs Guardrails https://t.co/MIokoEL5RF

Excited to join a stacked lineup of speakers at the @mlopscommunity LLMs in Production conference!

I'll be talking about the practical approach to building guardrails for LLM applications in production, and how @guardrails_ai can help! https://t.co/eNKMLG9m2C

Thrilled to collaborate with @dk21 and @weights_biases on a new course on building LLM-powered applications!  I talk about controlling LLM outputs w/ @guardrails_ai 

The course is very thoughtfully designed & goes pretty deep into the stages of LLM app development. Details 👇 https://t.co/r2vFWTVNOA

Had a fantastic time chatting with Charlie and Badar at @mlsecops on how to make LLMs safer and more usable in practical applications with @guardrails_ai. 
Check out the podcast below! 📣

I had a fantastic time chatting with @labenz about practical strategies for adding Guardrails to LLM applications at the Cognitive Revolution podcast! 

Check out my episode below 👇

Had a blast chatting with @FanaHOVA and @swyx about how to build Guardrails for AI for the Latent Space podcast!

Check out the episode below👇

🛤️ New @guardrails_ai release out!

✅Better logging support — optionally persist logs to disk
✅Manifest embeddings (with caching) by @laurel_orr1
✅More guardrails to validate generated summaries
✅A ton of bug fixes!

Try it out with “pip install guardrails-ai”

ICYMI: excellent thread on the implementation details behind AutoPR!

AutoPR automatically creates pull requests from issues, figuring out files to edit, diffs, etc. automatically

In the 🧵, @IrgolicR shares how he uses @guardrails_ai to check correctness of AutoPR’s actions👇

🤯 This is absolutely wild - a Github action that uses LLMs to automatically create a pull request for an issue!

AutoPR uses @guardrails_ai to ensure that generated diffs & commits are valid & correct

Check it out in action below 👇

name: Davis Treybig
bio: Early stage investor at Innovation Endeavors, focused on computing infrastructure, developer tools, & data. Former PM at Google.
texts: It is fun to see so many recent explorations in ways to scale foundation models to larger sequence lengths and deal with the quadratic scaling of self-attention. Some of the recent research work I have found most interesting:

In an effort to try to understand all these approaches in more depth, I've summarized them in much more detail here: https://t.co/aeRb4PTDsJ

If I am missing any other interesting research in this area, I'd love to see it.

And thanks to the many researchers who have led this work like @simran_s_arora @realDanFu @tri_dao @MichaelPoli6 @exnx @Massastrello @HazyResearch @ai_with_brains @liliyu_lili @simigd @HarshMeh1a @colin__flaherty @MaxMa1987 @violet_zct @XiangKong4 @LukeZettlemoyer @donglixp

Excited to be cohosting the first Claude 2 hackathon with @AnthropicAI @cerebral_valley with support from @LangChainAI @llama_index @arizeai @huggingface 

https://t.co/RvG7zh3kzy

Over the weekend of July 29-30, builders will receive API access to Anthropic’s new model, Claude 2, get hands-on support from our team, and connect with leading AI industry judges to be announced soon!
Winning teams will receive cash and credit prizes to kickstart their projects, as well as Anthropic swag. Hope to see y’all there!

Spent some time looking into WebGPU recently and shared some learnings here: https://t.co/yuE89Su1SY

Would love your thoughts @Tojiro @DasSurma @DaKangz @WebGPU @julianparc @lucasmcgartland @tqchenml @HongyiJin258

Hosting a foundation model builders meetup in Palo Alto in a few weeks: https://t.co/Ry1cBMNIyl. It will be "Show & Tell" style with a series of lightning talks - some of the speakers we have lined up include @jerryjliu0 @mattrickard @devstein64 @mlfoundry @tristanzajonc
We have a attendees registered from @DeepMind @huggingface @Replit @StanfordAILab @FacebookAI and tons of cool foundation model startups. Hope to see you there!

Recently put together a fairly comprehensive “primer” for our team internally on foundation models, covering things across research, productization, cost structure, use cases, architectures, etc. Sharing publicly in case it’s useful to others: https://t.co/6NgZwXVQ80

name: Tristan Zajonc
bio:
Cofounder/CEO at @Continual_AI.  AI, data, startups, economics. 
Formerly @Cloudera, @SensePlatform.
texts:
Llama 2 is remarkably simple. The https://t.co/bT4ugOWehj is 288 lines of Python and the entire repository is <1000 lines.
https://t.co/ifSkPdRcVX
Definitely one of the nicest APIs on top of LLMs today.
Hearing more and more stories of existing SaaS companies seeing real revenue inflection after implementing generative AI features.

This paper deserves more attention.  AI will increase the productivity and quality of knowledge workers.  But who benefits most? This paper provides experimental evidence that AI can compresses not increase the skill gap.
Are there promising contenders to replace vector search for context augmentation?  Injecting chunks into the context feels rather rudimentary honestly.
Technology can help humanity make the world cleaner, healthier, and more connected.  The future will be beautiful if we care enough to try.
I'm chatting next week about Production LLMOps with @willpienaar, @changhiskhan, and @Dan_Jeffries1.  It should be a lively discussion with diverse perspectives.  https://t.co/z7V3ZbMfYQ
Really looking forward to the new Google.  Or if not Google, https://t.co/LvEPUynbaY or https://t.co/q82E3bIoQj.   They are going to be awesome.
When you ask customers about generative AI use cases. https://t.co/ZBoR2jVz04

The rumors are true.  We've been hard at work building a next-generation developer platform for generative AI at @continual_ai.  We'll be sharing more soon, but you can sign up for early access here: https://t.co/C3H4Uy50Wo

name: Jerry Liu
bio:
co-founder/CEO @llama_index

Ex-ML @robusthq,  AI research @Uber_ATG and ML Eng @Quora. Princeton '17
texts: Amazing iteration speed!

If you’re at the @Anthropic Claude 2 hackathon today (@cerebral_valley), just FYI we have FULL native support for Claude 2 in @llama_index! 🧠

Just set ANTHROPIC_KEY_KEY env variable or customize yourself (s/o @mlpowered for suggestion) 🔑:

https://t.co/VtKXn7rK62 https://t.co/0bXXwKRd0H

A crucial choice when building a production RAG system is picking the right embedding model - not only does it affect performance, but also cost/latency/compute reqs ⚡️⚙️

💡The MTEB leaderboard on @huggingface is an awesome benchmark for understanding the best embedding models… https://t.co/ElHomCyCZn

The `rebel-large` model is awesome for relation extraction 🔗

Paired with CUDA, it’s blazing fast ⚡️. With @llama_index 🦙, we can now build a knowledge graph over any text data super quickly! 🕸️

Full Colab notebook showing how you can use it: 

https://t.co/0EUpzKjVWK https://t.co/m9w39CjMTb

Credits go to @PereLluisHC for the rebel model - full model card on @huggingface: https://t.co/ccVvyUM2YP

Also credits to @LoganMarkewich / @wey_gu for the framing + implementation!

As @OfficialLoganK mentioned in the reply, the LlamaIndex name technically came first before the LlaMa model 🙂. 

Thanks for featuring us!
Stoked to welcome Yi! We're building a team of superstars here at @llama_index 🦙🎉

For those of you who missed our webinar with @jxnlco  due to our meeting cap (sorry about that), the full recorded video is up! 

Come learn about how to use Pydantic with LLMs.
We'll have recording out asap! Sorry everyone, we've paid for Zoom Large Meetings going forward 🙂

Properly evaluating agents is an under-explored problem - what are the key tests you should run on inputs/outputs? 🧪🤖

Check out this brand-new notebook that helps to explore that on our @llama_index Yelp agent! 🧑‍🍳

Huge s/o to the @truera_ai team: https://t.co/jdVpvWPmML

Highlights in the 🧵 👇

name: Harini Kannan
bio: Working on something new. Previously generative AI @GoogleBrain and @MIT CS
texts: Congrats @realSharonZhou!

Excited to announce RoboDesk, a multi-task, pixel-based reinforcement learning benchmark that features 9 diverse tasks in the same environment. The tasks test for a wide variety of robotic skills and involve multiple interactive objects (drawers, buttons, various blocks). 🤖👇 https://t.co/PCAXAaT5EO

We carefully designed and tested RoboDesk to ensure fast and stable physics simulation. This avoids objects from intersecting, getting stuck, or quickly flying away, common problems that can occur with multi-object environments.

RoboDesk comes as a self-contained Python package with few dependencies. The source code is clean and pragmatic, making it a useful blueprint for creating new MuJoCo environments.

pip install robodesk

More info: https://t.co/tisnSTF0iL

(cc @danijarh @chelseabfinn @doomie)
Been using Boomerang http://t.co/mlwxsiYNYO to schedule messages in Gmail or make emails go away until I'm ready. Highly recommended.

name: Raza Habib
bio:
CEO @humanloop (YC S20) |Unbelievably excited about the future of AI. 

Follow me for updates on LLMs and how to build products with them.
texts:
I'm going to be judging at @AnthropicAI's first official Hackathon next weekend! 

Super excited to see what people build — there are only 150 spots, so sign up this week if you're interested!
https://t.co/8GuT6RCAki

I keep hearing people say things like "LLMs are just maths" or "It's just a bunch of matrices". This is literally wrong. 

We instantiate the maths physically as moving electrons inside a computer. LLMs have bodies and brains. They're data centres, wires etc

This is a really thoughtful defence of open-source foundation models from @jeremyphoward, well worth a read!

https://t.co/VKhYiHJwKc
Features like OpenAI functions create switching costs between model providers and will become a form of defensibility for OAI against Anthropic et al
I'd love to have Claude or GPT-4 as an extra attendee in zoom meetings where you can get them to quickly answer factual questions or brainstorm as a team member
Just set up pi from inflection to chat to chatGPT via https://t.co/us6rgydEXi. we live in crazy times
https://t.co/ctq5I1kuzr

This! 

It's really hard to behave in a way that is consistent with a belief that the models will get phenomenally better because it's so far outside of what we've experienced in the past.

Everyone has an opinion on the default AI/LLM stack right now.

Don't be fooled into thinking it's complicated. It's never been easier to build a compelling AI product. 

If you're unsure where to start, just get an API key and play!
"No GPUs before PMF" should be the mantra of most applied AI start-ups. The cloud LLMs are so good now, most people should start here and optimise later.

name: Rachel Woods
bio: Ex-Facebook Research Data Scientist. Pushing the envelope of operating businesses with AI. #AIOps
texts: What are the coolest projects these days where ChatGPT is generating prompts for itself? (github repos, etc)
Generative AI is still only as good as the prompts you give it.
The rules of how to build an AI-powered business are currently being written.
Love this.

A lot of the AI clickbait will say you're prompting ChatGPT wrong.

But the reality is there are multiple ways to prompt it, it just depends on what you are using it for. https://t.co/RVeNdxaZvv

We are teaching our upcoming Prompting for AI Ops course out of the OpenAI Playground. If you're serious about delegating your work to AI, then learning the Playground is a must. 

You have more control over settings and behaviors of the model.

It forces you to think in… https://t.co/ahqa9ectba

There are different levels of a prompt quality

And knowing what "level" you're at can help you design a good process around it:

Level 1: this prompt helped me start the work

Level 2: this prompt dramatically helped with the work

Level 3: this prompt dramatically helped…
So am I the only person struggling to find my "Twitter" open tab this week?

For the past few months, I've become obsessed with the problem of how do you build an AI-powered business

AKA - "how do we actually use this stuff"

But it honestly started because at the beginning of the year, I did hundreds of AI Advising calls with businesses  and while I was… https://t.co/yUTRdP8hE9
AI, because work should be more human

name: Jeff Wang 👨‍🚀
bio: Product Lead @MetaAI (FAIR). I like language models. I also like non-language models. Previously at Twitter and startups
texts: Happy Friday https://t.co/Fc8wQhMp9F
AGI🤖 or NHI👽

🦙Llama 2 is now available for both research and commercial use.

🔥 Trained with 40% more data (2T tokens) than LLama 1 and 2x context length
🛠️ Sizes: 7B, 13B and 70B
👑 Outperforms other OS models
🤗 Available on Azure, HuggingFace + more

Download model:… https://t.co/ICMYBLpxz6

- Paper: https://t.co/v6gjDXGX6a
- Blog: https://t.co/VIk07dv97n
- Website (Download): https://t.co/JzYwkSCjtv
- Github: https://t.co/KIlpOtgLbf
- HF Gradio demo: https://t.co/miYvULa02g https://t.co/bmHTW4sGvd
Benchmarks - https://t.co/8j6qayQuVl https://t.co/zGUzVIgeWf

Voicebox, a new generative speech model. What can it do? Here are some examples:

1. Transient noise removal. Getting interrupted by doorbell while recording speech? Voicebox can be used like a magic eraser to remove transient noise.

2. Content editing. Voicebox can also help…
See and hear sample examples here: https://t.co/sn1uMIrgyR
Read the paper: https://t.co/7P4V6kuJFy

Generate music 🎶 using natural language. 

Try out the demo. Get the code. Use the API. Read the paper. All available to you in @syhw’s 🧵 below.
